title: How to Make Mince Pie Twists

steps.headline: Place the flour, butter, sugar, and cream cheese into a food processor.
Pulse until it comes together into a dough.
Wrap with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least two hours.
Roll the dough on a lightly floured surface.
steps.description: Ensure the thickness is about 1 to 2 cm thick.

steps.headline: Spread the mincemeat over the dough, then cut of the edges.
Roll dough into a log beginning with one of the long sides.
Wrap the roll up in greaseproof paper.
steps.description: Put it in the freezer for about an hour.

steps.headline: Slice chilled dough crosswise into about about 1/4 inch thick slices.
Place them on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper.
Bake them for about 15 minutes, then remove them from the oven and allow to cool.
Dust them with some icing sugar mixed with cinnamon and serve.

text: Making the Dough Place the flour, butter, sugar, and cream cheese into a food processor.  Pulse until it comes together into a dough.  Wrap with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least two hours.  Rolling the Mince Pies Roll the dough on a lightly floured surface. Ensure the thickness is about 1 to 2 cm thick. Spread the mincemeat over the dough, then cut of the edges.  Roll dough into a log beginning with one of the long sides.  Wrap the roll up in greaseproof paper. Put it in the freezer for about an hour. Baking and Serving the Pies Preheat the oven to 200 °C (392 °F).  Slice chilled dough crosswise into about about 1/4 inch thick slices.  Place them on a baking sheet lined with greaseproof paper.  Bake them for about 15 minutes, then remove them from the oven and allow to cool.  Dust them with some icing sugar mixed with cinnamon and serve.
